document.s: When I get to heaven gonna sit down
Walk right in and sit down
My Lord told me to sit down
Sit down and rest a little while
Sit down, sister, sit down Walk right in and sit down
Oh, I want two wings To veil my face
I want two wings to fly away
I want two wings to veil my face
I want two wings to fly away
- Oh, meet me, Jesus, meet me.
If my two wings fail me
I want two wings To veil my face
I want two wings to fly away
I want two wings to veil my face
I want two wings to fly away
Gentlemenl Gentlemenl In your chairs, brothers and sisters.
I proposes that we devote the closing prayer to a faithful member of our flock... who is leavin' us tonight... to fill a position of great importance in foreign parts.
I refers to our brother, Brutus Jones.
Will you bow y'all's heads in prayer.
We, the people of Hezekiah Baptist Church... is gathered together for the purpose of givin' into your keepin'... our brother, Brutus Jones.
- Like the prodigal son in the story...
He's a-settin' out on a far journey!
But this boy ain't like the prodigal son!
He ain't shiftless, and he ain't worthless!
O Lord, he ain't pumped up... and he ain't vainglorious!
Mm-mmm, honey, you sure is wonderful in them clothes.
Yeah, I suppose these clothes is somethin' to look at back here, honey.
Where I been while I been training for the job, you wouldn't notice 'em.
You oughta see them New York gals on Lenox Avenue.
Them gals is fast, I bet... switching' theirselves to catch the mens.
But, honey, you wouldn't look at none of them fast gals... while you's away from home, would you?
They ain't none of'em as pretty in the face like my gal.
And that prodigal son... he takes the 'heritance what his pappy gives him... and he spend it on the fast life.
And the prodigal son, he is a liar!
You know, I looks up... and there's the Capitol building looking like a palace on the hill.
And the big front door opens... and the president of the United States marches down the avenue... with a band before and a band behind.
And he comes right up to my car, and he says, just as natural...
Well, Brutus, you sure is much of a man...
And I, for one, wants to compliment you on landing' the job."
Honey, they singin' the closing song at the church.
Jeff's train is gonna pick me up at the water tank.
But you knows they's waitin' to see you before you go.
I sure hates to leave my gal.
It's me, it's me, it's me, O Lord
Now let me fly Now let me fly
Now let me fly Now let me fly
Let me fly unto Mount Zion Lord, Lord
Now let me fly Now let me fly
Now let me fly Now let me fly
- Would you hold my hat, honey?
Let me fly unto Mount Zion, Lord, Lord.
Now let me fly Now let me fly

Way down yonder in the middle of the field
Angel workin' at the chariot wheel
He's not so particular 'bout the workin' at the wheel
Just wanna see how the chariot feel
Now let me fly Now let me fly
Now let me fly Now let me fly
Now let me fly unto Mount Zion Lord, Lord
I met that hypocrite in the street
First thing he do was to show his teeth
Next thing he do was to tell a lie
Best thing to do is to pass him by
Now let me fly Now let me fly
Now let me fly Now let me fly
Now let me fly unto Mount Zion Lord, Lord
I got a mother in the Promised Land
Make tracks, bo', 'cause we's ridin' right now.
- You is comin' back, ain't ya?
Get yourself a new dress with this, honey.
- And take care of yourself till I comes back, now.
'Cause you big time from this on.
Now, I suppose you think you know all's there is about this job.
Now we's gon' take up the higher education - finances.
And right here is where I estimates the profits for the run.
Now, if you brushes a dime out of this, you is doin' well.
And number three here, boy, that's good for a half.
If you plays your hand right, it means the long green.
- That's what I wanna tell you about.
There's two kind of womens that ride in a Pullman.
There's the kind that says, "Where you been, porter?"
That don't mean nothin' but a tip.
Then there's the kind that sings out, "Hello there, jackjohnson!"
And I'm gon' show you where to spend it.
I hate to see that evenin' sun go down
Everybody, meet my friend from South Carolina.
I got your fish and rice all ready for ya.
- You know, I'm from South Carolina myself.
- You told me you was from Georgia.
- Marcella sure had a busy ma.
She done born her in every state south of the line.
This is my New York home, bo'.
Didn't know I was comin'in, eh?
Honeyin' up to my gal, eh?
You ain't gonna send me to jail!
Pleased to meet you, Mr. Jones.
How do you like the city, big boy?
Soon as the train'll bring me.
In the locus' by the door
There's a hummin' and a strummin'
In the land from east to west
Honey, I's sure glad to see ya.
I get to missing' you more and more on these long runs.
You know, you oughtn't to ask me to come here to meet you.
He's a bad actor over me.
You ain't got nothin' to be afraid of.
I can handle that little two-bits porter.
You oughta throw him over anyhow.
Then it'd be just you and me.
You ain't got nothin' to worry about, honey.
But you ain't heard the good news yet.
I been transferred to the president's private car.
Why, Jeff say you don't make no tips on that job.
That's why he didn't take it.
That's the difference 'tween me and Jeff.
He can't see no bigger than two bits.
Why, I'd just be steppin' to my own class on that private car.
Harrington, if there is no leak... we stand to clean up millions.
I's awful worried about that merger.
Sure would be bad for us if that news got out.
- How long have you been with me, Jones?
I got about 300 in the bank.
All right, you're in the pool for $300.
I would rather you didn't leave the car until Sunday.
Two days solitary, but it'll be worth it.
And, Jones, when we get back to New York... it might be a good idea for you to go back on your old run.
There's more room for big men in Georgia.
Boy, you sure was born to wear that oyster front.
Where'd you get such a good fit?
Well, the boss and me talked it over, and he sent me to his tailor.
He said, "Jones, you got a position to live up to now... and you can't afford to be careless in your attire."
You and Mr. Harrington must be gettin' mighty thick.
We just pulled off a little deal together.
I give him some valuable advice, and he said, "Jones, you're learnin' fast.
And then he takes me into partnership.
- Ain't you goin' back on the Pullman no more?
- Oh, I'll stick by the job for a few more runs.
But things don't seem to be goin' quite right on that old run of mine... and the boss asked me to drop down that way and straighten 'em out.
When, since I guess you'll be down that way... you'll probably drop in the White House.
Look here, what you tryin' to do, kid me?
Then he takes me into partnership."
Where'd you get that money, in a crap game?
You done laughed yourself right off of my payroll.
Oh, honey, sweetheart, I didn't mean it.
No, you's too funny to live with.
Any woman is baggage what gets heavier and heavier, the longer you totes 'em.
You got to change 'em to keep travelin' light.
So you was all set to do this before you come in, huh?
Then you can go back toJeff.
He still thinks there ain't nobody like his Undine.
Well, you ain't the first man that's gone down-and-out... thinkin' everybody else was a fool.
I got eyes, even ifJeff ain't.
And you can tell that polecat Belle La Due... if she wants to keep on tryin' to look like Garbo, she'd better stay out of my way.
Well, if it ain't the old big-timer in from the west.
I've known Belle since before she straightened her hair... and when she went with Johnson.
I'm just trying to talk so that polecat can understand me.
What's the matter with you tonight, Undine?
I don't like you acting so to my pal.
Why, he's been biting' you in the back for a year.
I mean, when I get finished with Belle, he ain't gon' have much left to love.
I never saw you in such a mood.
- Get these nits back away from the table.
- Fellas, back upl Give him a chancel
Oh, we ain't in his way.
- Well, if you can't sing no better'n that, shut up!
Jeff's gal must have slowed him down!
You been tryin' to ride somebody ever since you come in here.
Let a man have elbow room.
Shake, rub and roll 'em here, brother.
- Yeah, Jones, give me a shooter there, somebody.
- Come on, give me a shooter.
Take that chicken feed off of here and play it on the line.
- Put in a nickel, he goes!
- Can't bet with it in your hand.
Who wants any part of these four sawbucks?
- Let the dice bring on misery.
Your coat sleeves stopping' my dice.
Let the hussy sprain her wrist.
I'm gon' cut you a brand-new mouth with these dice... and give you somethin' to put in it, you long, black snake, you.
- Say, Stumpy, were you on me then?
- Didn't I tell you never to get on my back?
- Yeah, but, honey, this is a crap game.
- Catch 'em hoppin' and let 'em hear 'em chatter.
- Twenty and a nickel I shoot.
- Twenty and a nickel he shoots.
- On the line, you small fish.
I knowed I'd have a crap game today.
- The Yankee boys is in town.
Well, if they is crooked, they stands just like him and here's where I straighten 'em both...
Came in rooting' round my back door
It seems to make me glow
One vice may not hurt you
All the way to the jail, boys
Water me from the lime rock branch
Well, I know you of old, boy
Yes, I know you of old
Well, I'll learn him how to run away.
Why, if I lay my hands on that boy, the Lord'll strike me dead.
Oh, Lord, I's glad to see you!
Listen, Dolly, you got to move fast.
Get me a file, a change of clothes.
I got to leave the country.
I hope this steamboat won't run aground.
Say, where is this tub stopping' next?
Ain't we stoppin' on none of these little islands on the way?
What's that little island with the white fort we been comin' on this afternoon?
Just one of them there little nigger islands.
- But nobody bother go that place.
Your Highness, Mr. Smithers is waiting to see you.
Well, Your Excellency, the goods has come... and I brought you a few samples.
First-class, just like I said they'd be.
Four hundred, cash, for the lot.
I got the contract this time.
Well, that's just the bloomin' point.
You see, uh, here it says...
Now then, there ain't the like of that consignment... within 300 miles... and the next boat don't get here for two months.
Now, ain't that an act of God, so help me?
- Where you get that trash from?
Come to make trouble on my island.
Lock him up and throw him on the first boat out.
I'll take this bloomin' nigger off your hands for you, Your Highness.
I wanna have a talk with him.
So that's what is, me lad, eh?
What they calls in the States a bad nigger, eh?
With the law on your trail and the bloomin' gallows waitin' for ya round the next corner, what?
Look a-here, white man, I comes and I goes, and that's my business.
Oh, well, that's the kind of a nigger you are, eh?
Not afraid to stand right up to your betters and tell 'em what's what.
You wouldn't be afraid of a bit of fight neither, would ya?
When I fights, there's somethin' in it, and I don't never fights on no empty belly.
Well, supposing' your belly was full... and you had a chance to get back at the stinkin' heathen what threw you out?
All right, now you get your rum and your eats, but you don't get a stinkin' penny.
And if anybody worries ya, you just tell 'em you belong to Mr. Smithers.
Well, this ain't regular, but maybe the dice'll do.
Now, they goes first to the gentleman with the Rolls-Royce.
Don't you know " Ha!" means shoot?
The whole pile goes to the gentleman with the Rolls-Royce.
I'll be dressed up here in a minute.
Now, Quaco, what do you say?
This whole pile against that Rolls-Royce.
Now, come on, you galloping' dominoes.
Ah, the team is mine, Quaco.
Women is women, and Brutus Jones is through.
Well, I'll see you boys next week.
I wonder what the blazes is keepin' that black ape.
Here, where do you think you're going?
Well... to tell you the truth, Mr. Smithers... the boys back in the bush seems to like my methods.
I's figuring' to open up a little trading' business next door here.
Cut my bleedin' throat, would ya?
After all I've done for you too.
Is that your idea of gratitude?
Well, I's always ready to listen to reason.
And while I'm unloading', if I was to hear anybody say somethin' about a partnership -
Fine fat chicken all ready for the tooth!
Great big chicken all ready for the tooth!
Pineapplel Big fat chicken ready for the toothl
- I'm sure glad to see ya.
Why don't you come in and pay your bill?
You know, every time I rides up here through that jungle... it gives me the creeps.
Say, you notice they shut the gates after us?
Look a-here, white man, is your nerves slippin'?
If you had to recruit an army for him, why did you have to get such big blokes?
I betcha they knows a man when they sees one.
Well, if there's any trouble, you've only got yourself to blame... saluting' him and callin' him " General."
There's any trouble, you just leave the general to me.
- You know, you gotta be diplomatic.
- Mr. Smithers to see Your Excellency.
Well, good day to you, Your Majesty.
As fine a body of men as ever I clapped me peepers on.
And well found... if I says it meself as fitted 'em out, eh?
Well, General, you got a swell army.
And I reckons, when you figure how little it's costing' ya... makes ya feel mighty proud.
Tell the general the truth now - Does you know how to figure?
Now, you see, I got a figurer.
Well, here you are, Your Excellency.
Now, then, there was a hundred uniforms at five dollars.
There was a hundred rifles at five dollars.
One cannon was five hundred, and the ammuni -
Well, it adds up to $4,000, Your Excellency.
It seems to me that there might be a little error.
Ah, well, here, let me have a look at it.
Yes, we all make mistakes now and again.
Check that off and tell it to the boss.
Don't you all knows I's got a charm?
Takes a silver bullet to kill Brutus Jones!
Take this bush nigger and throw him outta here.
All of you, get outta here.
Them what I wants to stay will hear from me in an hour.
I wants to confer with you.
If you ain't pulled it off!
I calls it stinkin' luck - havin' that nigger miss you twice at 10 feet.
You remember when Quaco got drunk in town last night... and I takes care of his gun while he sleeps it off?
Well, that's what I call brains.
This place smells more like a chain gang dump than a palace.
Say, Smithers, how ya likes the contract for doin' this dump over?
And don't make the mistake of thinkin' you's dealin' with any ignorant bush nigger.
I gives you an audience tomorrow.
And bring along them fashion sheets that I gets last summer.
And then I wants mirrors - plenty of'em.
And remember, Smithers, red's my color.
I always had a special taste for red.
Somehow that don't make enough noise.
Smithers... you has just had an audience with the EmperorJones.
Tell Smithers I'll sees him here.
Well, Smithers, what's on your mind this mornin'?
Remember what I told ya when you slapped that last tax on coffee - that you were cuttin' your own bloomin' throat?
There was a riot down on the village last night... and your tax collector got beaten up so his own mother wouldn't know 'im.
My army's got them niggers already.
And I'm gonna dress 'em down before the whole court this mornin'.
- Too late to give 'em a lesson now, me lad.
When I takes this job, what I tells ya?
I says three years for my cleanup, don't I?
Well, we's got six months to go.
Them's my arrangements, and I ain't gonna change.
I suppose you got your money hid away safe, eh?
And it's banked in a foreign land where they ain't no chain gangs and no jim crow... and nobody can't get it except me.
In six months, I walks out on this nigger circus.
And from then on, I's top dog.
There's little stealing', like you does... and there's big stealing', like I does.
For little stealing', they get you in jail sooner or later.
For the big stealing', they makes you emperor... and puts you in the hall of fame when you croaks.
Well, all I know is that it's a wise gambler that knows when to quit.
Do you think I ain't still got these niggers like that?
You think when I cracks the whip, they don't jump through?
His Majesty is on the throne.
And all points in His Majesty's kingdom... north, south, east and west.
So you's the niggers what takes it upon yourself to start a roughhouse... then beat up an officer of the crown?
Well, I see I been too easy on you niggers.
Now I'm gonna show ya who's boss around here.
Take them niggers in the courtyard and give 'em 50 lashes apiece.
Take your company to the five-mile village... and burn it off the face of the earth!
Who dare whistle that way in my palace?
Who dare wake up the emperor?
I'll get the hides frayed off some of you niggers sure.
It was me whistled to ya.
What news you got to tell me?
Where's all your court - the generals and the cabinet ministers and all?
Oh, they mostly runs the minute I closes my eyes.
Drinkin' rum, talkin' big down in the town.
How come you don't know that?
Ain't you sousin' with them most every day?
- I got to, in my business, ain't I?
When you landed here, you didn't have no high-and-mighty airs.
Now, what I was then is one thing, and what I is now is another.
I wasn't afraid to hire ya that time after you broke jail in the States.
No, you didn't have no excuse to look down on me for that.
- You been in jail yourself more than once.
Who told you that fairy story?
There's some things I ain't got to be told.
I can see 'em in folks's eyes.
From what I been told, it ain't safe for a black to kill a white man in the States.
Well, I tells you, Smithers... maybe I does kill one white man back there.
And maybe I kills another right here 'fore long if he don't look out!
You think I'd peach on ya?
I'm gonna show ya that I'm your friend.
I'll tell ya that bit of news I was goin' to.
Must be mighty bad news from the happy way you look.
Ain't noticed any of the servants or the guards... around the place this mornin', I ain't.
Oh, they all out in the garden sleeping' under the trees.
All I got to do is to ring that gong, and they come flyin'.
Ring it now, and you'll see what I mean.
The rotten ship is sinkin', and the bloomin' rats have slung their hooks.
Well, I reckon I overplays my hand this once.
Man can't take the pot on a bobtail flush all the time.
Was I sayin' I'd sit in six months more?
Well, I's changed my mind then.
I cashes in and resigns the job of emperor right this minute.
You're a cool bird, and no mistake.
When I knows the game's up...
I kisses it good-bye without no long wait.
They's all run off to the hills, ain't they?
Lem was taken 'em - every man jack of'em.
Then the revolution is at the post... and the emperor better get his feet smokin' up that trail.
Goin' to look for your horse, ain't ya?
They steals the horses first thing.
Oh, I got plenty of time.
Well, don't you be so blasted sure.
You'll have to hustle to get through that forest in 12 hours... even if you knew the trails like a bloomin' native.
Look a-here, white man, do you think I's a natural-born fool?
Why, I's gone out in that forest so many times pretending' to hunt...
I knows it high and low like a book.
I could find them trails with my eyes shut.
And I got tinned grub hid there under a big white stone where I can find it.
Oh, I'll be at the edge of the forest by the time dark comes.
And once in them woods, them niggers will never find me.
Dawn tomorrow, I reaches the coast and boards that French gunboat.
I got to laugh at these fool black trash around here.
Supposin' something happens and they does nab ya?
I's got five lead bullets in this gun good enough for common bush niggers.
And after that, I's got this silver bullet left... to cheat 'em outta getting' me.
I tells 'em, when the time comes, I kills myself with it.
That's 'cause I'm the only man in the world big enough to get me.
And you had a silver bullet made?
Five lead bullets and this silver baby at last.
- Keep your hands where they belong, white man.
You'd think I was a blasted thief.
I know you scared to steal from me.
I ain't allowing' ne'er a body to touch this baby.
You'll need all your bloomin' charms before long, so help me.
The blacks is havin' a war dance in the hills, workin' up their courage 'fore they start after ya.
They're makin' all sorts of devil spells and charms... against your silver bullet.
It takes more than that to scare this chicken.
Tonight, when it's pitch black in the forest...
They'll be sendin' their pet devils and ghosts hounding' after you.
You'll find your bloomin' hair will be standin' on end by tomorrow mornin'.
It's a mighty queer place that forest is, even in daylight.
You don't know what might happen there.
Always sends the cold shivers down me back the minute I gets in it.
You ain't talkin' to this baby.
And what's ghosts and hants got to do with me?
Well, don't you know I's a member in good standing' in the Baptist Church?
The Baptist Church done protect me.
You ain't paid much heed to your Baptist Church down here - takin' up with them blooming' witch doctors.
It don't get me nothin' to do missionary work for the Baptist Church.
I's after the coin... and I lays my religion on the shelf for the time being.
I ain't got the time to waste on no more fool talk with you.
I'm goin' away from here this second.
I'll see you in jail sometime maybe.
You ain't goin' out this way, are you?
You think I'd sneak out the back door like a common nigger?
And the EmperorJones leaves the way he come.
And that black trash don't dare stop him.
Listen to that roll call, will you?
Must be a mighty big drum to carry that far.
Well, if they ain't no whole brass band to see me off...
I sure got the drum part of it.
Give my regards to any ghosts you meet.
In the nick of time too.
That soft emperor job sure ain't no training'... for a long hike over that plain in the broiling' sun.
A wonder they wouldn't get sick of beating' that drum.
When did they start in after me?
That's what's the matter with you.
Nothin' but wind on your stomach.
Well, we eats right here and now.
White stone, white stone, where is you?
I knowed this was the right place.
Box of grub, come to me.
Has I got to go hungry in them woods all the night?
Can't tell nothin' from them trees.
Nothin' around here look like I ever seen it before.
I done lost the place sure enough.
Woods, is you tryin' to put somethin' over on me?
Oh, it was only a little animal.
They maybe rooted out your grub and eat it.
What you think they is - hants?
You give the game away when you fired that shot.
Them niggers'll hear that for certain.
There ain't nothin' there but the trees.
Get more light from this out, and you sees where you's gwine.
From now on, you has a snap.
It's warm, and that's a fact.
How long I been makin' tracks in these here woods?
This am a long night for you, Your Majesty.
Ain't much majesty about this baby now.
It's all a part of the game.
This night come to an end like everything else.
When you gets there safe and has that bankroll in your hands... you'll laughs at all this.
What you singin' for, you poor nigger?
Want all the world to hear you?
Sure gets nearer from the sound.
They're packin' it along with them.
What's that little queer clickety sound I hear?
That sound like some nigger was shootin' crap.
Time I beats it quick when I get them notes -
I sure am mighty glad to see ya.
But they told me you done died from that cut I gives ya.
How you come to be here, nigger?
Nigger, I kills you dead once.
Has I got to kill you again?
Hant or no hant, that shot fix him.
They's comin' fast, and here I is shootin' shots, let 'em know just where I is.
I'm melting' with heat... from runnin' and runnin' and runnin'.
I gets rid of them frippety emperor's trapping's... and I travels lighter.
How'd this road ever get here?
I never remember seein' it before.
These woods is sure full of the queerest things at night.
Lord God, don't let me see no more of them hants.
That was all in your head.
You just get seein' them things 'cause your belly's empty... and you sick with hunger inside.
Bless God I don't see no more of'em whatever they is.
I'll gets even with you yet sometime.
Give me my hammer, and I splits his head.
Give me a hammer, one of you.
I'll kills you, you white devil, if it's the last thing I ever does.
Ghost or devil, I'll kills you again!
Oh, Lord, what I gwine to do now?
Seem like I been here before.
Anyway, seems like I know that stone... and them trees... and the river.
Seem like I been here before.
Down here, where these fool bush niggers raisin' me up to the seat of the mighty...
I steals all I could grab.
Didn't my Lord deliver Daniel Why not every man
He delivered Daniel from the lion's den
Jonah from the belly of the whale
The Hebrew children from the fiery furnace
Didn't my Lord deliver Daniel, Daniel, Daniel
You done saved this sinner, Lord!
I'll bet he's miles away by now and safe at the coast.
I told you you'd lose him, didn't I?
Beatin' your silly drum and casting' your stinkin' spells.
Why don't you go in the woods and hunt after him?
Well, you ain't thinkin' that's him, I hopes.
I cook money, make silver bullet.
Well, they did for you right enough, Jonesy, me lad.
Where's all your high-and-mighty airs now, Your bloomin' Majesty?
Anyhow, you died in the 'eighth of style.
